items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
River levels are expected to be high as a result of spring tides.

The next high tide at Richmond at 17:00 on 05/07/23, may result in brief low-level flooding of riverside roads and open spaces.

Astronomical tide levels are rising. The river flow at Teddington Weir low for this time of year at 35 cubic metres per second and is rising. We anticipate the flows to remain low for the nextÂ 3 days.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

This message will be updated by 20:00 on 05/07/23, or as the situation changes, as subsequent tides over the next couple of days may be higher.
